climbs.name: Urban Sprawl
climbs.fa: FFA Solo - Rand Black, Paul Wollam, Brian Dutton - December 1984

content.description: A 4th class scramble/bushwhack leds to a common belay with Special Olympics. Follow thin 45° crack up and right to straight up medium-large hand crack.  Follow crack past crux, 5.6 to ledge above.
content.protection: Standard cam and wires rack - no belay bolts. Walk off belay ledge to west, then south and then back east to base of Nightmares.
content.location:
4th class about 60' up and left from belay of Nightmares to common belay of Special Olympics and Urban Sprawl.

 (See "Nightmares" topo for more info.)

content.description: A 4th class scramble/bushwhack leds to a common belay with Urban Sprawl, climb up crack past block, and continue upward, 5.5 fist crack to belay ledge.
content.protection: Standard cam and wires rack - no belay bolts. Walk off belay ledge to west, then south and then back east to base of Nightmares.
content.location:
4th class about 60' up and left from belay of Nightmares to common belay of Special Olympics and Urban Sprawl.

 (See "Nightmares" topo for more info.)

climbs.name: Nightmares
climbs.fa: Rand Black, Brian Dutton, Paul Wollam, Craig Akers - December 1984

content.description:
Pitch One:  From belay at base of drainage, climb 5.easy to a large block below the one bolt triangle face above. Climb up Triangle Face past bolt to crux, 5.7 (R & PG-13) -or- bypass up easy crack then right and up to the belay (no bolts) near top of Triangle.

Pitch Two: Traverse rightward along a horizontal fingertip crack under prominent roof, a few moves to the offwidth that splits the roof at 45°, turn roof/offwidth, 5.10-, left and up.  Then 4th class to no bolt belay at base of obvious offwidth above. (this is a very short pitch)

Pitch Three: Climb offwidth up through bulge, 5.9+ to top belay. (no bolt belay) Descent is a walk off/scramble, generally west, south then back east downslope back to base.
content.protection: 1st pitch: one old 3/8" Rawls self-drive bolt with a Leeper hanger.  Cams lower on route. 2nd pitch: small cams and very large cams (Camelot-4-6) 3rd pitch: mostly larger cams for the OW.
content.location: Follow up the drainage west about 0.13 miles uphill to belay at base below the triangle block w/ bolt. (see area description)

content.description: Currently, the east facing rockpile has only one known historical area of TRAD route development from 1984, featuring a three-pitch circuitous climb, and two adjacent short moderate 1 pitch routes.  The area is on Tonto National Forest land. The rock is the same as “Pinnacle Peak Granite: a porphyritic biotite granite with large microcline phenocrysts - Middle Proterozoic aged (1.4-1.45 Bya).”
